revised_title: Advances in North Sea Water Quality Modeling
tldr: This article discusses the development of water quality models for the North Sea, focusing on the physical processes, sources, sinks, and interactions of various water constituents. It outlines the current status of water quality models and the progress made in modeling suspended sediments, nutrients, dissolved oxygen, and metals. The article also highlights the importance of understanding particle-water interactions and the impact of human activities on water quality in the North Sea.
